Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: RESULTS : The cumulative incidence of persistent sterile leukocyturia ( > or = 75 cells / micro L in at least 2 consecutive visits ) after 96 weeks was 53 % .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the entities in the "Disease" category in the given paragraph:

| Disease |
| --- |
| persistent sterile leukocyturia |

Note that "persistent sterile leukocyturia" is a single entity, and it is not necessary to split it into separate entities for the purpose of this task.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Disease":

| Disease |
| --- |
| leukocyturia |

The entity "persistent" is not a disease, but rather an adjective describing the duration of the disease. Similarly, "sterile" is also an adjective modifying the noun "leukocyturia". Therefore, the only valid disease entity in the given paragraph is "leukocyturia".

Note: "leukocyturia" refers to the presence of white blood cells in the urine, "micro L" is a unit of measurement for volume (equal to one millionth of a liter), and "cells" refers to the actual white blood cells present in the urine.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

The entity "leukocyturia" does not clearly refer to a chemical entity, as it is a medical condition characterized by the presence of white blood cells in the urine. Therefore, it has been excluded from the list.
